column1: # title: Sea Ice Area climatologies and 21st century change in the CMIP5 and CMIP6 multi-model ensembles
# summary: This dataset comprises summary statistics regarding historical and projected Southern Hemisphere total sea ice area (SIA) and 21st century global temperature change (dTAS)
column2: evaluated from the multi-model ensembles contributing to CMIP5 and CMIP6 (Coupled Model Intercomparison Project phases 5 and 6). The metrics are evaluated for two climatological periods (1979-2014 and 2081-2100) from a number of CMIP experiments; historical
column3: and ScenarioMIP or RCP runs. These metrics were calculated to calculate projections of future Antarctic sea ice loss
column4: and drivers of ensemble spread in this variable
column5: for Holmes et al. (2022) "Antarctic sea ice projections constrained by historical ice cover and future global temperature change"

column1: # acknowledgement: Caroline Holmes was funded under as part of the British Antarctic Survey Polar Science for Planet Earth Programme and under NERC large grant NE/N01829X/1.
# comment: This table contains the model name and modelling centre for each model in the analysis
column2: the ensemble member ('RunID') and whether SIA was available pre-calculated as CMIP variable 'siareas' or was calculated by the author from variable 'siconc' ('source'). Other headers give the relevant variable name (sea ice area SIA and global mean surface temperature TAS; hist for historical and dSIA etc for future change) and the CMIP experiment from which data was taken. 'ECSexists' and 'TCRexists' indicate the availability of Equilibrium Climate Sensitivity (ECS) and Transient Climate Response (TCR) respectively. The details of the experiment protocol are given in O'Neill et al (2016):

column13: et al. (2016). The scenario model intercomparison project (ScenarioMIP) for CMIP6. Geoscientific Model Development

column6: P. R. (2022). Antarctic sea ice projections constrained by historical ice cover and future global temperature change. https://doi.org/10.1029/2021GL097413
